description: Launches an app or brings it to the foreground using its package name. Use this to start apps or switch between running apps.

params.name: package_name
params.label: Package Name:
params.description: The app's package name (e.g., com.example.myapp). Use the dropdown to see installed apps, or find it in Android Studio or app settings.

params.name: activity_name
params.label: Activity (Optional):
params.description: Specific activity to launch (e.g., com.example.myapp.MainActivity). Usually not needed - the app will launch its main activity.

description: Closes the specified application.
Installs an app from a given file path.

params.name: app_path
params.label: APK Path:
params.description: Full path to the .apk file

description: Uninstalls the specified application.
Clears user data for the specified application (requires adb/root?).
Clicks on a UI element (button, link, etc.) on the screen. This is the most common action for interacting with apps.

params.name: selector_type
params.label: Select By:
params.description: How to find the element: ACCESSIBILITY_ID (best for accessibility), ID (resource ID), XPATH (XML path), CLASS_NAME (element type), TEXT (visible text), UIAUTOMATOR (Android UI Automator)

params.name: selector_value
params.label: Selector Value:
params.description: The value to search for. For TEXT, use the exact text shown on screen. For ID, use the resource ID. For ACCESSIBILITY_ID, use the content description.

params.name: timeout
params.label: Timeout (s):
params.description: How long to wait for the element to appear before failing (in seconds)

description: Performs a long press on a UI element.
Types text into a text field, input box, or search bar. Useful for entering usernames, passwords, search terms, etc.

params.name: selector_type
params.label: Select By:
params.description: How to find the text input element: ACCESSIBILITY_ID (best), ID (resource ID), XPATH (XML path), CLASS_NAME (element type), UIAUTOMATOR (Android UI Automator)

params.name: selector_value
params.label: Selector Value:
params.description: The value to find the text input. For ID, use the resource ID. For ACCESSIBILITY_ID, use the content description or hint text.

params.name: text_to_input
params.label: Text to Type:
params.description: The text you want to type into the field (e.g., username, password, search term)

params.name: clear_first
params.label: Clear Before Input?
params.description: Whether to clear any existing text in the field before typing new text

params.name: timeout
params.label: Find Timeout (s):
params.description: How long to wait for the text input to appear before failing (in seconds)

description: Clears text from an input element.
Retrieves the text content of an element.
Retrieves the value of a specific attribute (e.g., 'checked', 'enabled', 'content-desc').

params.name: attribute_name
params.label: Attribute Name:
params.description: e.g., checked, selected, enabled, content-desc, resource-id

description: Swipes or scrolls the screen in any direction. Useful for navigation, scrolling lists, or revealing hidden content.

params.name: direction
params.label: Direction:
params.description: Which direction to swipe: UP (scroll down), DOWN (scroll up), LEFT (scroll right), RIGHT (scroll left)

params.name: percent
params.label: Swipe %:
params.description: How far to swipe as percentage of screen size. 75% = swipe 3/4 of the screen. Higher values = longer swipes

params.name: duration_ms
params.label: Duration (ms):
params.description: How long the swipe gesture takes (in milliseconds). Higher values = slower, more deliberate swipes

description: Swipes starting from the center of an element.

params.name: percent
params.label: Swipe %:
params.description: Percentage of screen dimension to swipe relative to element

description: Attempts to scroll until an element is visible (uses UiScrollable).

params.name: target_selector_type
params.label: Target Select By:
params.description: Selector for the element to find

params.name: scrollable_selector_type
params.label: Scroll Container Select By:
params.description: Selector for the scrollable container (optional, defaults to common types like ScrollView)

description: Performs a pinch (zoom out) or zoom (pinch open) gesture.

params.name: percent
params.label: Percent:
params.description: >100 for Zoom In, <100 for Zoom Out

params.name: steps
params.label: Steps:
params.description: Number of steps for the gesture

description: Presses BACK, HOME, ENTER, VOLUME_UP/DOWN etc.
Attempts to hide the software keyboard.
Opens the Android notification shade.
Opens the Android quick settings panel (may require swipe down twice).
Locks the device screen.

params.name: seconds
params.label: Lock for (s):
params.description: 0 or negative means lock indefinitely

description: Attempts to unlock the device (may only work if no secure lock screen).
Sets the device screen orientation.
Simulates shaking the device (emulator feature).
Simulates successful fingerprint auth (requires emulator setup).

params.name: finger_id
params.label: Fingerprint ID:
params.description: The registered fingerprint ID (1-10)

description: Pauses execution for a fixed duration.
Waits for an element to appear on screen before continuing. Essential for dynamic content that loads after page changes.

params.name: selector_type
params.label: Select By:
params.description: How to find the element: ACCESSIBILITY_ID (best), ID (resource ID), XPATH (XML path), CLASS_NAME (element type), TEXT (visible text), UIAUTOMATOR (Android UI Automator)

params.name: selector_value
params.label: Selector Value:
params.description: The value to search for. For TEXT, use the exact text shown on screen. For ID, use the resource ID. For ACCESSIBILITY_ID, use the content description.

params.name: timeout
params.label: Timeout (s):
params.description: How long to wait for the element to appear before failing (in seconds). Increase for slow-loading content.

params.name: visible
params.label: Wait for Visible?
params.description: True: Wait for element to be visible on screen. False: Wait only for element to exist in the page (may be hidden)

description: Waits for an element to become invisible or not present.
Checks if an element is currently visible on screen.
Checks if an element's text matches expected value (exact or contains).
Checks if an element's attribute matches expected value.

params.name: attribute_name
params.label: Attribute Name:
params.description: e.g., checked, selected, enabled, content-desc

description: Saves a screenshot.
Executes an arbitrary ADB shell command (Use with caution!).
Retrieves the XML source of the current screen.
